title: Cisco SD-WAN vManage impacted by unauthenticated REST API access
description: The Cisco SD-WAN vManage management software is impacted by a flaw that allows an unauthenticated, remote attacker to gain read or limited write permissions to the configuration of the affected instance. [...]

title: Google Play will enforce business checks to curb malware submissions
description: Google is fighting back against the constant invasion of malware on Google Play by requiring all new developer accounts registering as an organization to provide a valid D-U-N-S number before submitting apps. [...]

title: Windows 11 23H2 coming this fall as a small enablement package
description: Microsoft announced today that the upcoming Windows 11, version 23H2, will be available in the fourth quarter of 2023 as an enablement package since it shares Windows 11 22H2's code base and servicing branch. [...]

title: Fake Linux vulnerability exploit drops data-stealing malware
description: ​Cybersecurity researchers and threat actors are targeted by a fake proof of concept (PoC) CVE-2023-35829 exploit that installs a Linux password-stealing malware. [...]

title: Zimbra urges admins to manually fix zero-day exploited in attacks
description: Zimbra urged admins today to manually fix a zero-day vulnerability actively exploited to target and compromise Zimbra Collaboration Suite (ZCS) email servers. [...]

title: Source code for BlackLotus Windows UEFI malware leaked on GitHub
description: The source code for the BlackLotus UEFI bootkit has leaked online, allowing greater insight into a malware that has caused great concern among the enterprise, governments, and the cybersecurity community. [...]

title: Cyberattacks through Browser Extensions – the Importance of MFA
USB drive malware attacks spiking again in first half of 2023
description: What's old is new again, with researchers seeing a threefold increase in malware distributed through USB drives in the first half of 2023 [...]
